content:
Free software jobs http://www.fsf.org/resources/jobs/listing This is a meeting place where skilled and informed individuals working in the world of free software come to find job opportunities they can believe in. Think Penguin - PC Technician http://www.fsf.org/resources/jobs/think-penguin-pc-technician ThinkPenguin PC technician with solid foundation of Desktop GNU/Linux The job postings listed are written by the people hiring, and are not necessarily reflective of the Free Software Foundation.

ThinkPenguin has a part-time opening for one qualified candidate. We are looking for a capable, knowledgeable, independent, and responsible individual who can manage day-to-day operations. This mostly includes answering phones, taking orders, providing basic support, assembling computers, processing orders, and running daily errands.

We are looking for someone who:

  • Can put in: 30+ hours / week (up to 40)
  • Can work: 10:30AM-5:00PM M-F, Location: Flemington, NJ
  • Has a vehicle & drivers license
  • Has good communication skills
  • Pays attention to details
  • Has a lot of patience
  • Has at least basic GNU/Linux administrations skills (ie: apt-get, md5sum, dmesg, lsusb, lspci, etc)
  • Can work independently and without supervision
  • Can relocate to the Flemington, NJ area

Email your resume in PDF or ODT to jobs at thinkpenguin.com for consideration with salary requirements, current location, and where you found this job posting. Please send us a brief introductory letter as well. No recruiters please.

]]> No publisher 2015-03-06T20:55:00Z Document DevOps Engineer for SecureDrop http://www.fsf.org/resources/jobs/devops-engineer-for-securedrop SecureDrop is hiring a DevOps Engineer The job postings listed are written by the people hiring, and are not necessarily reflective of the Free Software Foundation.

Freedom of the Press Foundation (FPF), a non-profit journalism rights and technology organization based in San Francisco, is looking for a full-time DevOps Engineer for SecureDrop.

SecureDrop is a free software whistleblower submission system used by journalists to communicate with sources. It was originally created by Aaron Swartz and is now managed by FPF. SecureDrop is currently in use at over fifteen news organizations worldwide, including The New Yorker, Washington Post, Guardian, The Intercept, and ProPublica.

SecureDrop attempts to provide all of the tools to support the full life-cycle of a high-security environment, including host security, system monitoring and security alerting, and environment-wide vulnerability/patch management. While it\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds a complex system, FPF has two core SecureDrop engineers who will work with the DevOps Engineer to help them understand the system.

We have done a significant amount of work creating automated virtualized development and testing environments for SecureDrop, as well as automating SecureDrop\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds installation on production hardware with Ansible. As a DevOps Engineer, you will help us continue in this direction. Among other things, you will be responsible for:

  • fully automating the installation of SecureDrop on production hardware
  • optimizing our current set of automated development, build, and test environments
  • increasing test coverage of the environment
  • building a more comprehensive automated CI pipeline
  • improving the signal to noise ratio of our existing monitoring and reporting subsystems to help detect and prevent potential attacks

The DevOps Engineer will also be expected to occasionally advise and assist news organizations with the installation and setup of SecureDrop in their newsrooms.

SecureDrop is a project that tackles unusually hard\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdbut interesting\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdsecurity and usability problems. If you are passionate about saving developer\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds time and sanity, encouraging free software contributors, empowering whistleblowers, or just like a challenge, we encourage you to get in touch.

This is a full-time position with a competitive non-profit salary with outstanding benefits, including health, dental and vision insurance. We offer 14 paid holidays a year, as well as 20 paid time off days a year.

See below for a detailed list of the types of skills and experience needed for the position.

If you think you\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdd like to be a part of our team, please send a short cover letter and your resume with links to some samples of your work to jobs@freedom.press. Women and minorities are encouraged to apply.

Skills and Experience

Required:

  • Infrastructure automation tools for development and production environments. (Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Vagrant)
  • Some experience with unit testing for environments and automated testing tools (RSpec)
  • Continuous integration tools (Travis CI, Jenkins, Snap CI)
  • Version control (Git)

Would be great:

  • Experience managing and securing GNU/Linux servers and/or networks (grsecurity, OSSEC, iptables, pfSense)
  • Experience designing secure systems (threat modeling, protocol design, cryptography, etc.)
  • Python scripting or web application development
  • Free software contributions or experience

https://freedom.press/jobs/job-opening-devops-engineer-securedrop

]]> No publisher 2015-02-12T16:15:00Z Document GNUnet and Taler - Free Software Hackers http://www.fsf.org/resources/jobs/gnunet-and-taler-free-software-hackers Free software hacker positions at GNUnet The job postings listed are written by the people hiring, and are not necessarily reflective of the Free Software Foundation.

Description:

The new "D\ufffd\ufffdcentralis\ufffd\ufffd" research team at Inria Rennes (France) has several open positions for free software hackers interested in working on GNUnet and Taler.

GNUnet is GNU's secure P2P network, a project where we design and implement a new decentralised, privacy-preserving, secure network where you are in control of your data, and where your interactions with other participants leak as little data as possible.

Taler is a new free software and open standards-based socially responsible digital payment system.

Responsibilities:

  • Write free systems software (largely in C, but also sometimes other languages)
  • Practice good secure software engineering and good OpSec
  • Write quality documentation (in English) and engage with users
  • Participate in information security research (develop cryptographic protocols, measure and evaluate performance, write academic papers)
  • Help transition the developed software from academic prototypes into usable free software packages
  • PostDocs will be expected to participate in supervising PhD students, and developing their own ethical research agenda (including grant writing)
  • Consider the ethical implications of your work

Requirements:

  • Recognized Master's or PhD degree (depending on position) in a related area
  • Skills in systems programming, GUI programming, cryptography or secure software engineering
  • Working language is English
  • Must be willing to move to Rennes, France

Salary:

  • Depends largely on existing academic degree (Master's or PhD) and a bit on experience
  • Determined by Inria based on national rules (read: non-negotiable)
  • Inofficial sample calculations provided by Inria:
  • PhD student gets 3016\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd per month, makes a net salary of 1584\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd
  • Post Doc gets 4069\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd per month, makes a net salary of 2128\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd
  • (but, those 'net salary' calculations are based on some assumptions on the tax situation, which may not be accurate for you)

Pluses:

  • PhD students will be given the opportunity to write a PhD thesis
  • Inria offers non-financial support for the transition, including free language courses
  • Research environment, French-speakers are encouraged to teach, but will not be required to do so
  • France: 8 weeks of vacation/year, health insurance and other benefits

Please provide us with information you feel would be useful to us in gaining a better understanding of your technical background and accomplishments. Send your details to Christian Grothoff christian.grothoff@inria.fr via GnuPG-encrypted e-mail if you are interested.

About:

Inria is a French national laboratory. The Equipe D\ufffd\ufffdcentralis\ufffd\ufffd was created in late 2014 to research secure, privacy-enhancing network protocols. We are currently funded by the Renewable Freedom Foundation and Inria itself. The team is committed to only accept funding that allows us to work on free software and do ethical research.

The team is lead by Christian Grothoff http://grothoff.org/christian/ who currently maintains three GNU packages, including GNUnet.

]]> No publisher 2015-02-12T15:25:00Z Document Software Freedom Law Center - Executive Assistant http://www.fsf.org/resources/jobs/software-freedom-law-center-executive-assistant Software Freedom Law Center - Executive Assistant About:

The Software Freedom Law Center (\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdSFLC\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd) provides pro bono legal services to developers of free software. We provide our clients with licensing advice, license defense, trademark counseling, patent defense, and non-profit organizational assistance. We also produce educational and advocacy materials regarding legal issues related to free and open source software.

Position:

The SFLC seeks an Executive Assistant to provide full-time administrative support for the Executive Director and the office. The Executive Assistant is responsible for a broad range of duties.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Manages the Executive Director's calendar, scheduling and confirming meetings, and coordinating meetings and conferences.
  • Oversees the coordination of the Executive Director's travel arrangements and itineraries and prepares expense reports in compliance with SFLC guidelines.
  • Prepares correspondence, meeting agendas, reports, and presentations as directed.
  • Oversees collection of materials for and organization of the Executive Director's files.
  • Greets and directs visitors.
  • Manages the flow of incoming communications, reading, distributing and responding to correspondence for the office.
  • Screens and monitors calls and emails, fielding questions, and/or forwarding them to the appropriate person.
  • Handles special projects, conducts research, analyzes data and generates reports as instructed.
  • Helps to facilitate smooth operations of the office and to implement organizational objectives.

Minimum Qualifications:

  • A bachelor's degree or equivalent in education and experience, and a minimum of two years of related experience required.
  • MUST be detail-oriented with excellent verbal and written communications skills and strong interpersonal skills.
  • Familiarity with free software for office use.
  • Ability to set priorities, handle multiple assignments, and work with diplomacy and efficiency.
  • Driver's license preferred but not required.

Salary:

Commensurate with experience. Full benefits package provided.

To apply:

Please email a resume and cover letter, in a free format, to Tanisha Madrid-Batista, SFLC Business Manager, at tanisha@softwarefreedom.org

]]> No publisher 2014-12-19T19:14:34Z Document WordPress Engineer - First Look Media http://www.fsf.org/resources/jobs/wordpress-engineer-first-look-media First Look Media is looking for a WordPress Engineer based in either their San Francisco or Manhattan office. Founded by Pierre Omidyar, First Look Media is based on the belief that democracy depends on a citizenry that is highly informed and deeply engaged in the issues that affect their lives. First Look seeks to improve society through journalism and technology, to help individuals hold the powerful accountable, build responsive institutions and, most important, shape their communities and what happens in their lives for the better.

POSITION SUMMARY

First Look Media is looking for a software developer to support FLM's digital magazines. The Wordpress Engineer will provide domain expertise especially around Wordpress themes and the interaction of plugins, CSS, and Javascript in a multisite Wordpress environment at scale. Participate as a key member of a software development team focused on the implementation and continuous improvement of software development tools and methodologies with a focus on sustainable, professional quality engineering with a team approach. You must be able to thrive in a start-up environment and be able to work both collaboratively and independently as needed. This role can be based in either our San Francisco or Manhattan office.

Responsibilities:

  • Collaborate with the Product and Editorial Teams on projects.
  • Work closely with Designers and Product Teams to develop and launch new themes and sites
  • Create, edit, and modify Wordpress themes
  • Review design changes against analytical data and recommend improvements
  • Present multiple prototype solutions to high level requirements
  • Work cross-functionally with software developers and Site Operations personnel
  • Write tests to support Continuous Integration

Qualifications:

  • BA/BS degree or equivalent
  • 5+ years as a Web or Front-end developer
  • Experience with n-tier architectures, dynamic material, data caching strategies, and complex security models/implementations
  • CSS wizard
  • Experience with responsive design
  • UI/UX literacy
  • Expertise with Javascript frameworks
  • Wordpress Internals Expert including plugins and themes.
  • Expert with cross browser support techniques
  • Strong problem solving skills
  • Demonstrated ability to deliver aggressive project schedules on time
  • Previous experience configuring and using any or all of the following highly desirable: HTML5, PHP, AJAX, SOAP, Ant, Subversion, Git, Varnish, HAProxy, Wordpress, chef, puppet
  • Experience developing and integrating Web services APIs

Applicants can apply online at boards.greenhouse.io/firstlook/jobs/20107

]]> No publisher 2014-08-06T18:05:00Z Document ThinkPenguin - GNU/Linux Desktop Support Tech http://www.fsf.org/resources/jobs/thinkpenguin-gnu-linux-desktop-support-tech ThinkPenguin is hiring a GNU/Linux Desktop Support Tech! ThinkPenguin, Inc, focused on making free software adoption easy and hassle free is looking for an enthusiastic advocate to fill a tier one technical support role. The job is at our offices in Flemington, New Jersey.

The company is focused on expanding the worlds access to free software friendly hardware. In doing so we aim to make it easier for the masses to adopt free software.

Main Responsibilities:

  • assembling (mostly) & repairing computers
  • packing & shipping orders
  • diagnose and resolve technical hardware and software issues
  • providing basic tier one technical support
  • respond to customer requests for technical assistance in person (occasionally, local area only), via phone, and email (mostly phone/email)
  • research questions and solutions using internal and external documentation
  • identify and escalate situations requiring attention

Requires:

  • 30 hours / week (10:30AM-5:00PM M-F /w half hour lunch break)
  • vehicle & drivers license
  • skill in diagnosing problems
  • good communication skills
  • attention to detail
  • patience
  • a basic understanding of free software and its philosophy
  • basic GNU/Linux administrations skills/commands (ie: apt-get, md5sum, dmesg, lsusb, lspci, cat, etc)
  • staying current with the latest GNU/Linux distributions and other free software components / operating systems
  • Education and Experience: degree, degree seeking, or related experience and training in troubleshooting and providing help desk support are preferred

Key Skills & Competencies

  • oral and written communication skills
  • customer service oriented
  • problem analysis
  • problem-solving
  • adaptability
  • planning and organizing
  • attention to detail
  • stress tolerance
  • can work with little to no supervision

Email your resume for consideration with salary requirements to jobs@thinkpenguin.com.

All resumes must be submitted in a free format (such as plain text, PDF, or OpenDocument, and not Microsoft Word). Email submissions that do not follow these instructions will be overlooked.

We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to promoting a diverse workplace, and do not discriminate based on gender, sex, race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, marital status, or sexual orientation.

Find out more at: https://www.thinkpenguin.com/gnu-linux/gnulinux-desktop-support-tech

]]> No publisher 2014-06-19T18:45:00Z Document Looking for skilled and dedicated people? http://www.fsf.org/resources/jobs/new/employersection Support the free software community while finding a great new employee. Ready to list? Just email your listing to <job-page@fsf.org> and we'll post it just as soon as payment is received.

Not sure what a "free software job" is? We've put together a simple list.

Frequently Asked Questions

You're looking for the kind of people who are already hacking on and contributing to free, libre and open source software; the kind of people who can dive head on into a bug and fix it and are connected with the community.

Our jobs page is the #1 result when candidates search Google for "free software jobs". Likewise for searches for "software jobs", many users will find us on the first page of results. The GNU Project and Free Software Foundation websites receive millions of visitors each month, so you can be sure that your job listing will be seen.

We'll put you in touch with the dedicated, hard-working people you want for your jobs. But hey, don't just take our word for it...

Lucas C. Wagner, of Spindletop Software Dynamics, Inc. says:

The GNU jobs page represents, to me, one of the easiest and most effective ways to post jobs that require the knowledge and expertise of the free software community at large. Applicants are often extremely experienced, talented individuals who are donating their time both "on the clock" and "after hours" improving or extending the GNU software or other free software projects that their employers depend on. Additionally, applicants are often more than willing to help their employers connect (or remain connected) to the free software community so that further contributions to enterprise-critical projects can be gained from a network of thousands of people, from independent programmers to other employers just like you. It is for this reason that I highly recommend the GNU jobs page to employers serious about their commitment to using and/or building upon free and/or GNU software.

Ready to list? Just email your listing to <job-page@fsf.org> and we'll post it just as soon as payment is received.

]]> No publisher 2008-03-24T20:00:00Z Document Frequently Asked Questions http://www.fsf.org/resources/jobs/new/faq
How much does it cost to post a job?
USD 250 for 30 days. There are occasions when a job may be listed for less (sister organizations or patrons may get a discount.) Contact us for details!
How long will it run for?
30 days, unless you ask us to remove it sooner. If you want to run it for longer than 30 days, we have discounted rates available.
Where does the money go?
Back into the free software community where it will support and protect the creation of more free software.
Who will see it?
The GNU Project and Free Software Foundation websites are amongst the most popular websites on the internet, receiving millions of visitors each month. We've been around for nearly 25 years, and candidates searching for "free software jobs" on Google will find us listed at the top of results. Likewise for searches for "software jobs", many users will find us on the first page of results. Your ads will be seen by skilled programmers seeking jobs they can believe in.
Are there any rules about the kind of jobs I can list?
Yes. We only want to promote jobs that are for free software. You should check out our guidelines for more information, and if you have any questions, contact us by email at jobs-page@fsf.org.
How do I edit or remove my job post?
To edit or delete your job posting, just contact us by email, jobs-page@fsf.org
What about further bulk deals, internship or non-profit discounts?
Just drop us a line at,<job-page@fsf.org> We'll be happy to talk with you about discounts or respond to any other questions or suggestions you may have.
]]> No publisher 2008-03-24T20:00:00Z Document So you want to know.... http://www.fsf.org/resources/jobs/new/index_html What's a free software job? A free software job is any job centered on the creation, promotion, oversight, support, sales, marketing or installation of free software.

Here are some common examples of free software jobs:

  • GNU/Linux systems administrator
  • Web developer using free software like PHP, Python, Ruby, Django and Apache
  • Organizer working to install GNU/Linux or Open Office in elementary schools
  • BSD installation and support, coupled with hardware sales
  • MySQL database administration
  • Bounties or short-term free software coding jobs
  • On-site instructor for free software like Plone or MySQL

Here are some examples of jobs that don't fit the criteria:

  • 20% GNU/Linux sysadmin and 80% internal support for desktops running a proprietary operating system
  • Developing proprietary software applications, even if they run on the GNU/Linux operating system
  • Jobs focused on proficiency with proprietary applications, even if some free software is involved
  • Jobs that don't have anything to do with software at all

If you've got a free software job that you're ready to list, just email it to job-page@fsf.org and we'll post it just as soon as payment is received.

]]> No publisher 2005-03-25T23:42:53Z Document
